flask_mail module¶

flaskext.mail¶

Flask extension for sending email.

class flask_mail.Attachment(filename=None, content_type=None, data=None, disposition=None, headers=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates file attachment information.

Versionadded:

0.3.5
Parameters:
  • filename – filename of attachment
  • content_type – file mimetype
  • data – the raw file data
  • disposition – content-disposition (if any)

configure_host()[source]¶
send(message, envelope_from=None)[source]¶

Verifies and sends message.

Parameters:
  • message – Message instance.
  • envelope_from – Email address to be used in MAIL FROM command.
send_message(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Shortcut for send(msg).

Takes same arguments as Message constructor.

Versionadded:0.3.5

Bases: UnicodeDecodeError

class flask_mail.Mail(app=None)[source]¶

Bases: flask_mail._MailMixin

Manages email messaging

Parameters:app – Flask instance
init_app(app)[source]¶

Initializes your mail settings from the application settings.

You can use this if you want to set up your Mail instance at configuration time.

Parameters:app – Flask application instance
init_mail(config, debug=False, testing=False)[source]¶
class flask_mail.Message(subject='', recipients=None, body=None, html=None, sender=None, cc=None, bcc=None, attachments=None, reply_to=None, date=None, charset=None, extra_headers=None, mail_options=None, rcpt_options=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates an email message.

Parameters:
  • subject – email subject header
  • recipients – list of email addresses
  • body – plain text message
  • html – HTML message
  • sender – email sender address, or MAIL_DEFAULT_SENDER by default
  • cc – CC list
  • bcc – BCC list
  • attachments – list of Attachment instances
  • reply_to – reply-to address
  • date – send date
  • charset – message character set
  • extra_headers – A dictionary of additional headers for the message
  • mail_options – A list of ESMTP options to be used in MAIL FROM command
  • rcpt_options – A list of ESMTP options to be used in RCPT commands
add_recipient(recipient)[source]¶

Adds another recipient to the message.

Parameters:recipient – email address of recipient.
as_bytes()[source]¶
as_string()[source]¶
attach(filename=None, content_type=None, data=None, disposition=None, headers=None)[source]¶

Adds an attachment to the message.

Parameters:
  • filename – filename of attachment
  • content_type – file mimetype
  • data – the raw file data
  • disposition – content-disposition (if any)
has_bad_headers()[source]¶

Checks for bad headers i.e. newlines in subject, sender or recipients. RFC5322: Allows multiline CRLF with trailing whitespace (FWS) in headers

is_bad_headers()[source]¶
send(connection)[source]¶

Verifies and sends the message.

send_to¶
flask_mail.force_text(s, encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')[source]¶

Similar to smart_text, except that lazy instances are resolved to strings, rather than kept as lazy objects.

If strings_only is True, don’t convert (some) non-string-like objects.
